availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David C. Hall (Meade County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Meade County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Hall and Apaline Hall. Married to Hellen Hamilton in Meade County, Kentucky, on May 17, 1859. Father of Benjamin Hall, Apheline Hall and John Hall. Attended school in Meade County in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Meade County in 1850. Farmer in Meade County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Meade County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, p. 222B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kentucky, Meade County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, p. 427.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, p. 32A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, Ashcrafts, p. 288A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Meade County Marriages, Film 000390324.
